channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: RFK Jr. to face questions about chaos at the CDC
item.description: Democratic lawmakers and more than a thousand current and former HHS staff say Kennedy's actions are endangering America's health. Kennedy says he cam...

item.title: How the Education Department is using civil rights laws to bring schools to heel
item.description: The Trump administration is using decades-old laws, meant to prevent discrimination, to threaten school districts and states with cuts to vital federa...

item.title: Sen. Warren says banking panel should focus on Trump's attacks on Fed independence
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Sen. Elizabeth Warren, the top Democrat on the Senate Banking Committee, about Stephen Miran's nomination to the Fed a...

item.title: Are creatine supplements all that they're pumped up to be?
item.description: Creatine supplements have long become increasingly popular as social media influencers tout its benefits. What does the evidence say?

item.title: Sell it, donate it — recycle it? A beloved old minivan faces a fork in the road
item.description: After 20 years of service, an NPR reporter's beloved minivan is on the fritz. But what is its best and highest calling now: Pass it on to another fami...

item.title: "48 Hours" show schedule
item.description: True crime. Real justice. To miss it would be a crime.

item.title: Dozens die after boat hits tree stump in Nigeria
item.description: The overloaded boat was carrying passengers including children when it hit a submerged tree stump.

item.title: Allies ready to support Ukraine before and after peace deal, says UK
item.description: The UK and other allies hope to obtain clear US backing for their efforts to shore up Ukraine's defences.

item.title: 'Out of control': Witnesses describe fatal Lisbon funicular crash
item.description: The crash killed at least 17 people and injured 20 more, some critically, Portuguese authorities say.

item.title: Soldiers doused with gas, set on fire during mission to destroy cocaine lab
item.description: Colombia's defense minister posted video of one of the victims, calling the perpetrators "criminals and narcos who attempted to murder our soldiers."

item.title: Who are the victims of the Lisbon funicular cable crash?
item.description: A transport worker is among those killed, while a three-year-old German boy is reported to have escaped with minor injuries.

item.title: Guyana President Irfaan Ali claims victory in general election
item.description: The incumbent president claimed victory in an election dominated by how to manage the country's vast oil reserves.

item.title: The government's next jobs report lands Friday. Here's what to look for.
item.description: After President Trump expressed "shock" over the pace of hiring in July, much is riding on the employment data for August.

item.title: Powering tomorrow: unpacking the energy transition in ""The heartbeat of our societies – Transitioning towards a clean energy future"" from Wärtsilä
item.description: The heartbeat of our societies – Transitioning towards a clean energy future," a documentary from global technology group, Wärtsilä, explores the ongo...

item.title: Death toll in Lisbon streetcar crash mounts, leaving Portugal reeling
item.description: Lisbon's Elevador da Gloria funicular streetcar has carried tourists in Portugal's capital for more than a century. The cause of its deadly crash rema...

item.title: Trump suggests National Guard could go into New Orleans, a blue city in a red state
Texas lawmakers approve letting private citizens sue abortion pill providers
Judge reverses Trump administration’s cuts of billions of dollars to Harvard University
item.description: A federal judge in Boston has ordered the reversal of over $2.6 billion in federal funding cuts to Harvard University.
